headlines: Here’s what happened in crypto today
Federal Reserve Board publishes first of several staff manuals for the supervision of the largest and most complex banks
Federal Reserve Board withdraws 2023 policy statement and issues new policy statement regarding the treatment of certain Board-supervised banks that facilitates responsible innovation
Federal Reserve Board announces termination of enforcement actions with The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. and Metropolitan Commercial Bank
Agencies announce dollar thresholds for applicability of truth in lending and consumer leasing rules for consumer credit and lease transactions
events: Institutional adoption of stablecoins via Coinbase (Polkadot USDC access)
Regulatory uncertainty over U.S. crypto market structure
Spot Bitcoin ETFs seeing significant inflows ($457M) indicating early institutional positioning
SEC lawsuit against third-party Bitcoin mining services classifying them as securities—potential regulatory clarity or crackdown.
SEC compliance insights for Real World Assets (RWA) – regulatory clarity development
Bitcoin testing $85,000 resistance with significant liquidations
Brazilian stock exchange launching tokenization platform and stablecoin – major adoption milestone
Taiwan's Bitcoin holdings reported, suggesting geopolitical positioning in crypto.
Bitcoin ETFs saw significant inflows ($1.3 billion), indicating strong institutional interest and adoption.
